name: places/ChIJL5rAKWf3wokRJyVX37Okx4E
formattedAddress: 2492 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10030, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2492 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10030, USA

originalText.text: I've ordered food from this place before through uber eats, and I ordered recently and was pretty appalled with the quality of the food that I couldn't even eat it. I had ordered a fish and chips meal, two of them actually, and noticed the food looked like it had been re-fried. (food made earlier that got cold or didn't sell and was re- fried) Firstly i'm disappointed that they could have the audacity to sell food to someone knowing it wasn't fresh. This is disgraceful and disrespectful to someone who has ordered food previously and knows you can do better.

originalText.text:
This has been in the neighborhood for a little while but this is my first visit. It will most likely be my last. These people can't count and they damn sure can't cook.
I had a butler named Latoya when I was in Jamaica last week and I should have had her cooking for me. That escovich fish I had was not only dried up and kind of hard but the fish was a bit off. It was either old or going bad and it was obvious that they used a little extra pepper pickle to cover up the old fish taste with heat and spice. Metric may fool some people, but if you've got the least bit discriminating palate, you're going to see through this. The cabbage that I had was a little dry as well. When something's been sitting in the heating and warming pan for a while and you serve it up, it's probably a good idea to give it a good stir before you give someone the dried hard part at the top. This did not happen. That said, at least that didn't taste bad. The peas and rice were good.
The service left a lot to be desired. Now it is customary every once in a while for people to make mistakes when they are giving change and I do know that few people use cash. My order came to $8.72 . I gave the young lady who was ringing me up. She gave me one back $1 change and when I asked her for the rest of the change her manager very loudly got back to me and said why did I think I should have some change if I gave her $10. Now this lady was on the phone with someone at the time that the transaction happened and I said I gave her $10.75 and she said exactly the order was $8.72 she gave you back a dollar. I explained that I needed to have $2.03 change. The sad thing is I would have thrown one of those dollars in for a tip. But after that response from a manager that was not only wrong but loud and condescending before she caught herself and apologized. I kept both my dollars and my paltry $.03
I have been really. I work in the service industry myself. I also am a person with a learning disability so I have a certain amount of sensitivity to people when it comes to issues and shortcomings. I also don't work at all if I don't treat my customers and clients with more respect than I got. So if you want second rate Jamaican food and a nasty attitude then go right on ahead and eat here.

originalText.text: I really love this place. The bbq ribs were drenched in sauce like I like it. And my girlfriend loved the sweet and sour ribs so I got some points from that. I just picked up the chicken and I’ll be back for the wings!

text.text: I really love this place. The bbq ribs were drenched in sauce like I like it. And my girlfriend loved the sweet and sour ribs so I got some points from that. I just picked up the chicken and I’ll be back for the wings!

originalText.text:
Order on Uber Eats. They have their ROTI section but when you select an option for your roti it just processes as a dinner plate. I received two plates of curry chicken. Rice was a bit stale and the order of plantains was inedible. Very hard and rubbery. Over all I was very unhappy with my experience. The only positive thing was when I called the restaurant to let the employee know, she apologized and said she would let the owner know.

It's odd because there is a review here from 11 months ago with the same issue and it hasn't been changed? Will not order again.

originalText.text: I am giving them a 2 only because the oxtail was cooked. Everything else was flavorless. The pasta was overcooked. The macaroni and cheese just had cheese on top and the oxtail did have pepper/spices. Also, I give them a 2 because I didn't have to cook. Island food my foot.
